discord_only_workflow_instructions.overview: Specialized workflow for generating Discord-formatted release notes from existing release files. This allows users to quickly get Discord-ready announcements without creating release notes from scratch.

entry_patterns.description: User messages that trigger the Discord-only workflow

patterns.pattern: Discord announcement for X.Y.Z, A.B.C, D.E.F

step.title: Parse Version Numbers
step.action: Extract version numbers from user request
step.details: Support multiple formats: - Single version: "3.23.14" or "v3.23.14" - Multiple versions: "3.23.14, 3.23.15, 3.23.16" - Mixed formats: "v3.23.14, 3.23.15, v3.23.16"

parsing_rules.rule: Split by commas for multiple versions

step.title: Check File Existence
step.details: Check docs/update-notes/ for each requested version file (vX.Y.Z.mdx)

missing_files.example: <ask_followup_question> <question>I couldn't find release notes for the following versions: v3.23.16, v3.23.17. Would you like me to:</question> <follow_up> <suggest>Generate Discord notes for the versions that exist (3.23.14, 3.23.15)</suggest> <suggest mode="release-notes-writer">Create release notes for v3.23.16 first</suggest> <suggest>Cancel this request</suggest> </follow_up> </ask_followup_question>

step.title: Process Each Version
step.action: Generate Discord format for each existing version

transformations.transform: Convert internal links to full URLs

option.name: highlights_only
option.action: Include only major features and important fixes

step.title: Combine Multiple Versions
step.action: When multiple versions requested, intelligently combine content

substep.action: Sort versions in descending order (newest first)
substep.reason: Present most recent changes first for better visibility

substep.action: Extract and merge content by category

category.name: major_features
category.description: Combine all major features across versions
category.format: List under unified "## Major Features" section

category.name: bug_fixes
category.format: Group under "## Bug Fixes" with version indicators

substep.action: Add version indicators to each item
substep.example: * **File Handling**: Fixed large file errors (v3.23.15) (thanks user!)

substep.details: If same contributor appears in multiple versions, list once

step.title: Format Output
step.action: Present Discord-ready text based on version count
step.single_version_format:
# Roo Code X.Y.Z Release Notes
[Summary sentence from original]
## [Major Feature Name]
[Feature description without PR links]
## Bug Fixes
* **[Fix Name]**: [Description] (thanks [contributors]!) * **[Another Fix]**: [Description] (thanks [contributors]!)
[Full X.Y.Z Release Notes](https://docs.roocode.com/update-notes/vX.Y.Z)
step.multiple_versions_combined_format:
# Roo Code Release Notes (vX.Y.Z - vA.B.C)
Combined release notes for versions X.Y.Z through A.B.C.
## Major Features
* **[Feature Name]** (vX.Y.Z): [Description without PR links] * **[Another Feature]** (vA.B.C): [Description]
## Bug Fixes
* **[Category]**: [Fix description] (vX.Y.Z) (thanks [contributor]!) * **[Category]**: [Another fix] (vA.B.C) (thanks [contributor]!)
## Improvements
* **[Improvement Type]**: [Description] (vX.Y.Z) * **[Another Type]**: [Description] (vA.B.C)
--- Full release notes: - [X.Y.Z Release Notes](https://docs.roocode.com/update-notes/vX.Y.Z) - [A.B.C Release Notes](https://docs.roocode.com/update-notes/vA.B.C)
step.multiple_versions_separate_format:
# Roo Code Release Notes
## Version X.Y.Z
[Summary and key changes]
## Version A.B.C
[Summary and key changes]
--- Full release notes: - [X.Y.Z Release Notes](https://docs.roocode.com/update-notes/vX.Y.Z) - [A.B.C Release Notes](https://docs.roocode.com/update-notes/vA.B.C)

format_selection.rule: Use combined format when user explicitly requests "combined" or "merge"
Use combined format for 2-3 closely related patch versions (e.g., 3.23.14, 3.23.15)
Use separate format for many versions or major/minor releases

step.title: Provide Copy Instructions
step.action: Give user the formatted text with copy guidance
step.completion_message:
Here's the Discord-formatted release notes. You can copy and paste this directly into Discord.
[Include formatted text in a code block for easy copying]

length_warning.action: Warn user about Discord's character limit and suggest splitting

detail.name: no_file_creation
detail.description: This workflow does not create or modify any files
detail.reason: It only reads existing files and outputs formatted text

detail.name: no_github_api
detail.description: No GitHub API calls are needed
detail.reason: All information comes from existing release note files

detail.name: immediate_response
detail.reason: Simple file reading and text transformation

example.name: single_version
example.workflow: 1. Parse version: 3.23.14 2. Check file exists: docs/update-notes/v3.23.14.mdx ✓ 3. Read file and transform 4. Output Discord-formatted text

example.name: multiple_versions_separate
example.user_request: Generate Discord announcement for v3.23.14, v3.23.15, v3.23.16
example.workflow: 1. Parse versions: 3.23.14, 3.23.15, 3.23.16 2. Check files: v3.23.14.mdx ✓, v3.23.15.mdx ✓, v3.23.16.mdx ✗ 3. Ask user how to proceed with missing v3.23.16 4. Process existing versions 5. Determine format: separate sections for each version 6. Output Discord announcement with version sections

example.name: multiple_versions_combined
example.user_request: Combine Discord release notes for 3.23.14 and 3.23.15
example.workflow: 1. Parse versions: 3.23.14, 3.23.15 2. Check both files exist 3. Read and process both versions 4. Detect "combine" keyword - use combined format 5. Merge features, fixes, and improvements with version tags 6. Output single combined announcement

example.name: with_compression
example.user_request: Discord notes for 3.23.14, compress the minor fixes
example.workflow: 1. Parse version and compression request 2. Check file exists 3. Read and transform with compression 4. Output condensed Discord format

example.name: range_request_combined
example.workflow: 1. Parse range: 3.23.14 to 3.23.16 2. Find all versions in range 3. Process each version's content 4. Combine into unified sections with version indicators 5. Output merged announcement

scenario.name: no_versions_found
scenario.trigger: User provides version numbers but no files exist
scenario.response: Explain that no release notes exist and offer to create them

scenario.name: invalid_version_format
scenario.trigger: User provides invalid version format (e.g., "3.23" without patch)
scenario.response: Ask for clarification on the full version number

scenario.name: ambiguous_request
scenario.trigger: Unclear if user wants Discord format or full release notes
scenario.response: Ask for clarification with suggested options
